I would say Big 4 audit's future prospect is not that bright (when comparing to advisory/ consulting) due to the prevailing trends of automation work done by robotics in the coming 10 years + the saturated market of CPA qualification in HK + low-cost outsourcing services in Mainland.

The exit opportunity would be compliance / risk / bank related jobs / managers in Big four, which is comparable to some conglomerates (generally, you will be AM after 3-4 years, being Manager after 6-8 years, pay maybe similar to Swire/P&G etc).

However, the starting salary is quite low for Big Four (plus its high working hours), that's why it is a third tier job for graduates (given that there is a lot of headcount in Big Four every year).

Airline-related jobs (HAECO, Hong Kong Airline = generally 16-17K), Cathay IT/Engineer Trainee ard 20K. When comparing to other MT in bank, congro, the starting salary is lower [exception: being a pilot].

For future opportunities, HK airline industry will continue to be more fierce when taking the disruption of low-cost carriers and Chinese airline companies into account. That means the cost-cutting phenomenon would be more serious.

The most significant example would be the continuous decline of profits in Cathay in recent years.

同問點解 Cicc/Boci/icbci 呢類中資行算1st-tier? 佢地人工、前景、brand recognition 同外資行係唔係有出入？

Citi同BAML 係堆BB 入面嘅ranking 點解咁低？


1. Becos Chinese I-Bank's bonus is very high in recent years. Base ~50K for front office jobs, which is quite desirable for fresh grad. In future, deals in chinese ibank will be even more competitive to BB

2. For Citi, their starting salary for IBD is comparatively low (~60K when comparing DB ~70K, even HSBC 70K+) but the revenue is still strong in Hong Kong.
For BAML, their presence in Asia in investment banking is not that strong.

Ching點睇各大行既corporate bank


In terms of starting salary, HSBC global banking (~45K) > Jpm treasury (42k) > baml corporate (36k) > Standard chart cb/ cib (31k, second year ~37k) > hsbc cb (28k, two years later ~40k) > hang seng/ Boc mt (25k)

But if taking bonus into account (can be ard 6mth bonus), Boc maybe equivalent to the foreign ones

In terms of career prospect, foreign banks / Ibanks training would be better and more competitive. In ibank, you would learn more products like syndicated loan, dcm, financial supply chain stuff with more exposure. For local/ Chinese, it is more hierarchal, rm position is generally dominated by mainland people.
